title.native: ゴールデンカムイ 第二期

description: The high-stakes search for gold continues in the harsh wilderness of Hokkaido! More and more people seek the treasure map, and the race to find its living pieces is brutal as all get-out. War veteran Sugimoto and his guide to the wilds, Asirpa, are hot on the trail, and as long as they stick together through thick and thin—chitatap and miso—they’ve got a shot at finding that gold.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Indigenous Cultures
tags.description: Prominently features real-life indigenous cultures.

node.description:
__Current Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Website](https://723000451898910026.weebly.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/satorunoda)

Satoru Noda  is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known as the creator of the manga series [Golden Kamuy](https://anilist.co/manga/86559/Golden-Kamuy/), for which he won the 2016 Manga Taishō and the Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize.

He used to be the assistant of [Yasuyuki Kunitomo](https://anilist.co/staff/114715/Yasuyuki-Kunitomo) and [Mitsurou Kubo](https://anilist.co/staff/96926/Mitsurou-Kubo).

__[Website](https://www.sayuri-official.com/)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1wLdD1RVGp_rLH1NRJnD0A)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taltalasuka)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sayuri149cm/)__

Sanketsu Shoujo Sayuri (lit. "Suffocating girl Sayuri") was a Japanese singer, musician and songwriter, signed under Ariola Japan.
Sayuri labeled herself as a 2.5D-parallel singer/songwriter, meaning she expressed herself through the internet in the 2D world and through live performances in the 3D world. 
For her 2D appearance she created various characters, mainly used in her music videos. While they all bear the name of Sayuri, each character's name differentiates itself by a different mix of Hiragana and Katakana (さゆり, サユリ, サゆり).

Sayuri made her major debut with the single "[Mikazuki](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=65BAeDpwzGY)", which was used as the ending theme to the Fuji TV anime "[Ranpo Kitan: Game of Laplace](https://anilist.co/anime/21189/Ranpo-Kitan-Game-of-Laplace/)".  Her first full-length album “Mikazuki no Kokai”, released May 17, 2017, debuted at #1 on Oricon’s daily album chart.

Sayuri announced her marriage to the vocalist and composer Ama Arashi (from the music group Misekai) on March 18th, 2024.

On September 27, 2024, her husband posted [an announcement](https://x.com/taltalasuka/status/1839500307094450552) on her X/Twitter account that she had passed away on September 20, 2024 at the age of 28.

name.native: マイファーストストーリ

node.description:
A Japanese rock band from Shibuya, Tokyo. Formed in 2011, the band currently consists of vocalist Hiroki Moriuchi, guitarist Teruki Nishizawa, bassist Nobuaki Katou, and drummer Shouhei Sasaki.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tk_mogi)

Color designer who works frequently with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayama11)

Married to [Atsuko Ueno](https://anilist.co/staff/216671/).

Older brother of [Kenji Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/105419/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayama11)

Married to [Atsuko Ueno](https://anilist.co/staff/216671/).

Older brother of [Kenji Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/105419/).

Originating from Eagle Nest. Currently freelance.

Tanaka first drew attention for the wild and imaginative fight sequences in Precure [Max Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/1929/) and [Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). Following this he expanded his scope and took up work on productions all around the industry, showing that fights aren't everything he can do. His variety on running sequences, often showing an effiminate touch, as well as the particular attention to hair, down to all little strains and often involving a hairdo having a life of its own, are some of Tanaka's most outstanding feats.

__Non-anime credits:__
~!
- Chief Animator, Animation Character Design, Storyboard, Director, Animation Director, Key Animation for "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger (OP)" (video game, 2008)
- Key Animation for "Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness (OP)" (video game, 2013)
- Key Animation for "livetune adding Fukase (from SEKAI NO OWARI) 「Take Your Way」" (music video, 2013)
- Key Animation for "Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan Saisen (OP)" (video game, 2011)
- Key Animation for "Valkyria Chronicles III" (video game, 2011)!~

After joining [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise) and serving as a production assistant, he made his debut as a director in the 10th episode of [Aoki Ryuusei SPT Layzner](https://anilist.co/anime/3079/Aoki-Ryuusei-SPT-Layzner/).

After joining [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise) and serving as a production assistant, he made his debut as a director in the 10th episode of [Aoki Ryuusei SPT Layzner](https://anilist.co/anime/3079/Aoki-Ryuusei-SPT-Layzner/).
